summary: This bill, the Smithsonian American Women’s History Museum Act, focuses on the establishment of the Smithsonian American Women's History Museum. It allows the museum to be located within the National Mall Reserve, amends existing legislation to clarify site selection processes involving other federal agencies, and mandates the museum's exhibits and programs accurately and comprehensively represent the diversity of women's experiences, including varied political viewpoints. The bill requires the Smithsonian to report to Congress on its progress. It amends sections of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021 by clarifying site location and diversity provisions.
